intro: Hieracium dentatum subsp. dentatiforme, commonly known as the toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. It has serrated, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with ray florets. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban areas.
